meanings.definition: A person or thing that perishes.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the hero bravely faced the perilous journey, knowing that many perishers had failed before him.
meanings.sent2: During the harsh winter, the small village lost many perishers to the cold and hunger.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel warned the acorns about the hungry birds, telling them to stay hidden to avoid becoming perishers.
meanings.sent4: The old castle stood as a reminder of the perishers who once roamed its halls, now only echoes of the past.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter rushed into the burning building, determined to save any perishers trapped inside.

meanings.definition: A comic strip created by British cartoonist Dennis Collins.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, the children eagerly read the latest adventures of the Perishers in the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The Perishers comic strip always brought a smile to the faces of its readers with its lovable characters.
meanings.sent3: In the funny twist, the Perishers characters decided to open a bakery, but their bread always turned out burnt, making them the worst bakers in town.
meanings.sent4: The Perishers comic strip was a window into a whimsical world where even the most ordinary days turned into extraordinary adventures.
meanings.sent5: The artist behind the Perishers had a magical way of bringing the characters to life, making them beloved by fans of all ages.
